page.title: 14THE FIRE STATION,CHELTENHAM
page.content: The Cheltenham Fire Station is situated in Keynsham Rd. It is one of four full_time stations which comprise the Gloucestershire Fire and Rescue Service.It became operational in January 1960.The area it is responsible for is 25,228 hectares.The station has 60 Junior Officers and firemen.The day watch is from 0900 hrs until 1800 hrs when it is relieved by the night watch who remain on duty until 0900 hrs the next day.Each fireman is on duty for about 42 hours a week.The station has 3 pumping appliances,a hydraulic platform,a rescue appliance,a salvage tender,as well as a number of ancillary vehicles like personel carriers,etc.The fire station responded to 1509 calls including 424 false alarms from Jan. 1st to Dec.31st,1984.Four years ago the R.Chelt flooded the fire station!
